definition: Hong Kong, abbr. for 香港[Xiang1 gang3]/surname Gang

sentences.english: It is the most beautiful beach in Hong Kong, and there are many facilities.
sentences.chinese: 那是全港最美麗的海灘，而且那裏設施頗豐。

sentences.english: In 1958, won the cha-cha open champion in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 1958年，獲全港恰恰舞公開大賽冠軍。

sentences.english: There are 60 parishes and 33 centres for Mass.
sentences.chinese: 全港共有60個堂區和有33個彌撒中心。

sentences.english: Air conditioners account for about 60 percent of Hong Kong's electricity usage in the hot, humid, sub-tropical summers.
sentences.chinese: 在炎熱潮溼的夏季，空調耗電量佔全港耗電的六成。

sentences.english: There are more than 50 Tin Hau Temples here.
sentences.chinese: 全港有五十多座天后廟呢。

sentences.english: The last review of the TDS was completed in 1996.
sentences.chinese: 全港發展策略最近一次檢討於一九九六年完成。

sentences.english: A navigation beacon is mounted on the largest tern island in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 全港最大的燕鷗島上設有導航燈。

sentences.english: There are now five cottage areas in Hong Kong housing some 2800 people.
sentences.chinese: 現時，全港有五個平房區，居民約2800人。

definition: Tsim Sha Tsui, urbanized area in Hong Kong
Hong Kong Island/abbr. for 香港島|香港岛[Xiang1 gang3 dao3]
Tsuen Wan district of New Territories, Hong Kong
Sham Shui Po district of Kowloon, Hong Kong
Tuen Mun district of New Territories, Hong Kong
Wan Chai district of Hong Kong
Taibei or Taipei, capital of Taiwan
